autumn.util

Class Predicates

  • java.lang.Object
    • autumn.util.Predicates

  • public final class Predicates
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static utility methods for creating commonly used predicates.

      • forall

        public static Predicate forall(Predicate predicate)
        This method creates a new predicate that requires that all the elements in an iterable satisfy another predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - is the predicate that each element in the iterable must satisfy.
        Returns:

      • forany

        public static Predicate forany(Predicate predicate)
        This method creates a new predicate that requires that at least one of the elements in an iterable satisfies another predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - is the predicate that an element in the iterable must satisfy.
        Returns:
        the newly created predicate.

      • between

        public static Predicate between(java.lang.Comparable minimum,
                java.lang.Comparable maximum,
                boolean inclusive_minimum,
                boolean inclusive_maximum)
        This method creates a predicate that determines whether its argument is between two specific values.
        Parameters:
        minimum - is the lower bound of the argument.
        maximum - is the upper bound of the argument.
        inclusive_minimum - is true, iff the minimum is inclusive.
        inclusive_maximum - is true, iff the maximum is inclusive.
        Returns:
        the newly created predicate.

                   boolean inclusive_minimum,
                   boolean inclusive_maximum)

        public static Predicate stringMatches(java.lang.String pattern)

        Parameters:
        pattern - is the regular expression pattern.
        Returns:
        the newly created predicate.

      • stringStartsWith

        public static Predicate stringStartsWith(java.lang.String prefix)
        This method creates a predicate that determines whether its argument's string representation starts with a specific prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix - is the possible prefix of the argument's string representation.
        Returns:
        the newly created predicate.
